sentences.en: A colonel is subordinate to a brigadier general.
Brigadier - General George Yeo once said, braving storms together will make a people more united.
sentences.cn: 杨荣文准将曾说过:共患难能让人们团结起来.

sentences.en: Colonel is the military rank between lieutenant - colonel and brigadier.
sentences.cn: 上校是陆军中校之上、准将之下的军衔.

sentences.en: He became a brigadier general before leaving the military in 1966.
sentences.cn: 他的军人生涯升至准将，随后在1966年退伍。

sentences.en: I have nominated Brigadier de Guingand as Chief of Staff Eighth Army.
sentences.cn: 我已经委派德圭因甘德准将担任第八集团军参谋长.

sentences.en: Immediately he was recommended for the grade of brigadier general.
sentences.cn: 他立刻就被保举晋升为准将.

sentences.en: In 1931 he was promoted to the rank of brigadier general.
It says three army officers, including a brigadier-general, were ambushed and killed on Sunday by armed criminal gangs who then mutilated the bodies with sharp tools.
sentences.cn: 据称，周日，武装犯罪团伙伏击了包括一名准将在内的三名陆军军官，并使用利器将他们的尸体砍断。

sentences.en: The brigadier had a moment's hope.
sentences.cn: 那位队长一时觉得很有希.

sentences.en: The Brigadier thought about this for a moment, head cocked to one side.
sentences.cn: 这位准将头歪向一边，就此考虑了一会儿。

sentences.en: The brigadier was cashiered for his big mistake.
sentences.cn: 旅长因犯重大错误而被革职.

sentences.en: What quality brigadier becomes commerce to compete is important cross a code.
sentences.cn: 质量标准将成为商业竞争的重要跨码.

phrases.tran_cn: 美国空军或海军陆战队准将

trans.tran_en: a high military rank in the British army, or the person who has this rank
